content:
DataGridViewColumnHeaderCell+DataGridViewColumnHeaderCellAccessibleObject Class

In this Article

Provides information about a DataGridViewColumnHeaderCell to accessibility client applications.

Syntax

Declaration

protected class DataGridViewColumnHeaderCell.DataGridViewColumnHeaderCellAccessibleObject : System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewCell.DataGridViewCellAccessibleObject

Inheritance Hierarchy

  • System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewCell+DataGridViewCellAccessibleObject
  • DataGridViewColumnHeaderCell+DataGridViewColumnHeaderCellAccessibleObject

Remarks

Windows Forms includes built-in accessibility support that allows your application to work with accessibility client applications. Examples of accessibility client applications include screen enlarger and reviewer utilities, voice input utilities, on-screen keyboards, alternative input devices, and keyboard enhancement utilities.

The DataGridViewColumnHeaderCell.DataGridViewColumnHeaderCellAccessibleObject class inherits from the AccessibleObject class to provide information about a DataGridViewColumnHeaderCell to accessibility client applications. Each class that represents a visual part of the DataGridViewâ€”such as DataGridViewColumnHeaderCell, DataGridViewRowHeaderCell, DataGridViewRow and DataGridViewCellâ€”also contains a class that inherits from AccessibleObject to provide information about the containing class and perform actions on behalf of accessibility client applications.

There are instances when you will want to provide additional information, such as the name or description of the DataGridView control, to accessibility client applications. There are two ways of providing this additional information. To provide limited accessibility information for existing controls, set the control's AccessibleName and AccessibleDescription property values, which will be reported to accessibility client applications.

Note

You should change the AccessibleDefaultActionDescription and AccessibleRole property values only in rare situations, such as if you make a DataGridView look like a list.

Occasionally, you might require more accessibility information or different accessibility actions to be included with your custom DataGridView or DataGridViewCell. To customize accessibility, you can write your own class that derives from the DataGridView+DataGridViewAccessibleObject or DataGridViewCell+DataGridViewCellAccessibleObject classes and override the CreateAccessibilityInstance method. For example, if you are writing a custom row header cell that implements unique custom actions, such as special hit testing within your cell, you should create a class that inherits from the DataGridViewRowHeaderCell+DataGridViewRowHeaderCellAccessibleObject class and override the CreateAccessibilityInstance method.

The DataGridView exposes its data structure by using AccessibleRole values to define the data table hierarchy. For more information on exposing data tables to Microsoft Active Accessibility, see "Exposing Data Tables through Microsoft Active Accessibility" in the MSDN library at http://msdn.microsoft.com/library.

Constructors summary

Initializes a new instance of the DataGridViewColumnHeaderCell+DataGridViewColumnHeaderCellAccessibleObject class.

Gets the location and size of the accessible object.

Gets a string that describes the default action of the DataGridViewColumnHeaderCell+DataGridViewColumnHeaderCellAccessibleObject.

Gets the name of the DataGridViewColumnHeaderCell+DataGridViewColumnHeaderCellAccessibleObject.

Gets the parent of the DataGridViewCell+DataGridViewCellAccessibleObject.

Gets the role of the DataGridViewColumnHeaderCell+DataGridViewColumnHeaderCellAccessibleObject.

Gets the state of the DataGridViewColumnHeaderCell+DataGridViewColumnHeaderCellAccessibleObject.

Gets the value of the DataGridViewColumnHeaderCell+DataGridViewColumnHeaderCellAccessibleObject.

Methods summary

DoDefaultAction()

Performs the default action associated with the DataGridViewColumnHeaderCell+DataGridViewColumnHeaderCellAccessibleObject.
Navigate(AccessibleNavigation)

Navigates to another accessible object.
Select(AccessibleSelection)

Modifies the column selection depending on the selection mode.

Constructors

  • DataGridViewColumnHeaderCell+DataGridViewColumnHeaderCellAccessibleObject(DataGridViewColumnHeaderCell)

    Initializes a new instance of the DataGridViewColumnHeaderCell+DataGridViewColumnHeaderCellAccessibleObject class.

    public DataGridViewColumnHeaderCellAccessibleObject (System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewColumnHeaderCell owner);

    Parameters

    • owner
      DataGridViewColumnHeaderCell

      The DataGridViewColumnHeaderCell that owns the DataGridViewColumnHeaderCell+DataGridViewColumnHeaderCellAccessibleObject.

Properties

  • Bounds

    Gets the location and size of the accessible object.

    public override System.Drawing.Rectangle Bounds { get; }

    Property Value

    • Rectangle

      A Rectangle that represents the bounds of the accessible object.

  • DefaultAction

    Gets a string that describes the default action of the DataGridViewColumnHeaderCell+DataGridViewColumnHeaderCellAccessibleObject.

    public override string DefaultAction { get; }

    Property Value

    • String

      A string that describes the default action of the DataGridViewColumnHeaderCell+DataGridViewColumnHeaderCellAccessibleObject

    Remarks

    If the DataGridViewColumnHeaderCell belongs to a column with a SortMode property value of DataGridViewColumnSortMode, this property returns the string "Press to sort column". If the SelectionMode property of the DataGridView control has a value of DataGridViewSelectionMode or DataGridViewSelectionMode, this property returns the string "Press to select column". If neither of these conditions is present or the DataGridViewColumnHeaderCell does not currently belong to a column, this property returns Empty.

  • Name

    Gets the name of the DataGridViewColumnHeaderCell+DataGridViewColumnHeaderCellAccessibleObject.

    public override string Name { get; }

    Property Value

    • String

      The name of the DataGridViewColumnHeaderCell+DataGridViewColumnHeaderCellAccessibleObject.

    Remarks

    The name of the DataGridViewColumnHeaderCell+DataGridViewColumnHeaderCellAccessibleObject is the same as the HeaderText property of the cell's DataGridViewColumn.

  • Parent

    Gets the parent of the DataGridViewCell+DataGridViewCellAccessibleObject.

    public override System.Windows.Forms.AccessibleObject Parent { get; }

    Property Value

    • AccessibleObject

      The parent of the DataGridViewCell+DataGridViewCellAccessibleObject.

  • Role

    Gets the role of the DataGridViewColumnHeaderCell+DataGridViewColumnHeaderCellAccessibleObject.

    public override System.Windows.Forms.AccessibleRole Role { get; }

    Property Value

    • AccessibleRole

      The AccessibleRole value.

  • State

    Gets the state of the DataGridViewColumnHeaderCell+DataGridViewColumnHeaderCellAccessibleObject.

    public override System.Windows.Forms.AccessibleStates State { get; }

    Property Value

    • AccessibleStates

      A bitwise combination of AccessibleStates values. The default is AccessibleStates.

    Exceptions

    • InvalidOperationException

      The value of the stem.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewCell.DataGridViewCellAccessibleObject.Owner* property is null.

    Remarks

    The State property value always includes the AccessibleStates value. The State includes the AccessibleStates value if the DataGridViewColumn that contains the cell is selected. The State includes the AccessibleStates value if the owning cell is not currently displayed.

  • Value

    Gets the value of the DataGridViewColumnHeaderCell+DataGridViewColumnHeaderCellAccessibleObject.

    public override string Value { get; }

    Property Value

    • String

      The value of the DataGridViewColumnHeaderCell+DataGridViewColumnHeaderCellAccessibleObject.

    Remarks

    The Value property is the same as the Name property.

Methods

  • DoDefaultAction()

    Performs the default action associated with the DataGridViewColumnHeaderCell+DataGridViewColumnHeaderCellAccessibleObject.

    public override void DoDefaultAction ();

    Remarks

    The default action is indicated by the DefaultAction property.

  • Navigate(AccessibleNavigation)

    Navigates to another accessible object.

    public override System.Windows.Forms.AccessibleObject Navigate (System.Windows.Forms.AccessibleNavigation navigationDirection);

    Parameters

    • navigationDirection
      AccessibleNavigation

      One of the AccessibleNavigation values.

    Returns

    • AccessibleObject

      An AccessibleObject that represents an object in the specified direction.

    Remarks

    The following table describes which DataGridViewColumnHeaderCell owns the AccessibleObject that is returned by the Navigate method.

    Parameter value Description
    AccessibleNavigation The DataGridViewColumnHeaderCell to the right of the current header cell.
    AccessibleNavigation The DataGridViewColumnHeaderCell to the left of the current header cell.
    AccessibleNavigation The DataGridViewColumnHeaderCell after the current header cell.
    AccessibleNavigation The DataGridViewColumnHeaderCell before the current header cell.
    AccessibleNavigation The first DataGridViewColumnHeaderCell. Navigate returns the DataGridViewTopLeftHeaderCell if the RowHeadersVisible property is true.
    AccessibleNavigation The last DataGridViewColumnHeaderCell.
    Note

    The direction that the Navigate method moves when you specify AccessibleNavigation or AccessibleNavigation depends on whether the DataGridView has right-to-left support enabled. For example, if right-to-left support is enabled, Navigate will return the same accessible object when you specify AccessibleNavigation or AccessibleNavigation. If right-to-left support is not enabled, Navigate will return the same object when you specify AccessibleNavigation or AccessibleNavigation.

  • Select(AccessibleSelection)

    Modifies the column selection depending on the selection mode.

    public override void Select (System.Windows.Forms.AccessibleSelection flags);

    Parameters

    • flags
      AccessibleSelection

      A bitwise combination of the AccessibleSelection values.

    Remarks

    If the owning cell does not belong to a column, no action is taken. Otherwise, the following table describes the action performed for each flags value.

    Parameter value Action
    AccessibleSelection If the DataGridView control that contains the owning cell has a SelectionMode property value of DataGridViewSelectionMode or DataGridViewSelectionMode, the column containing the cell is selected.
    AccessibleSelection If the column containing the cell is selected, the selection is canceled.
    All other AccessibleSelection values No action is taken.
